instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
no water damage..port "1" 20v 2A port "2" 5v 0.04a PPBUS_G3H 12.3V on both.
replaced U3100 that control this port, the same, check all LDO pp1v1_upc_xa_ldo_bmc 0v diode mode 472(on U3200- 480)
where it can come from?

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
If charger switches to 20V when connected to U3200, then U3100 should be good partyially; T2 communicates with it at least.
You should have a problem on U3100 input side.
Compare diode mode readings between both ports in pages 30/31 and Q3100/200.
Inspect USB-C terminals for corrosion.

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
cant make it...
replaced j3300, switch between U3100 and U3200,  also switch between Q3100/200 and also between q3440/30 and q3450/60 .
still the same...very weird..the XA side is the problem.. now i get PP1V1_UPC_BMC 1.1V but still 5v 0.05a

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
The other port switches to 20V?

Don't swap components without reason.
Check what I said first.
Probably corroded resistor, or broken trace.

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 85118, member: 682"]
The other port switches to 20V?
[/QUOTE]
yes other port(XB side) is 20v 2-3A
will keep searching

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message: Broken trace to U3100 corresponding pads.

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message: at USBC_XA_SBU1/2?

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message: That seems to be; the lines where you get OL, different that other port.

o.k now USBC_XA_SBU1/2 is 750 in diode mode...
but still 0.7v on both..

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
Both ports switch to 20V now?
Did you check what happens, if battery is connected?

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message: No, still just one port, with battery is the same

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
Check all traces for Q/U3100 and adjacent components.
Test all resistors related with U3100/200.

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
I2C_UPC_[COLOR=rgb(184, 49, 47)][B]XA[/B][/COLOR]_DBG_CTL_SDA diode mode is 500 I2C_UPC_[B]BA[/B]_DBG_CTL_SDA 720 the only thing that i see.
all traces for Q/U3100 are o.k

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message: both  I2C_UPC_[B]XA/BA[/B]_DBG_CTL_SDA ARE 3.2V

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message: Just in case, change the USB redriver chip, U3000.

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
already did it.
i was now take out U3200/100and compere each pad.
is U3100- TP_USBC_XA_RESET_L (O.L) is the same as U3200- USBC_XA_RESET_L (760). (diode mode)

threads.title: 820-01521 one of the port is 5v
threads.message:
TP_USBC_XA_RESET_L  has no other connection than U3100; is normal to get OL w/o chip on the board.
USB_X_RESET_L goes to U3200 and U2800 at same time.
